message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SP, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.MM 

The paper deals with the problem of recovering a block-sparse signal from under-sampled observations, which is a common problem in signal processing and information theory. The paper also mentions the application of the problem in DNA micro-arrays, which falls under the category of computational biology (cs.CB). However, the main focus of the paper is on the mathematical and computational aspects of the problem, which suggests that the paper is more likely to belong to the categories of information theory (cs.IT), signal processing (cs.SP), machine learning (cs.LG), statistical learning (cs.SI), or multimedia (cs.MM). Among these categories, information theory and signal processing are the most relevant ones, as they deal with the fundamental aspects of the problem, while machine learning, statistical learning, and multimedia are more application-oriented. Therefore, the most likely categories for this paper are cs.IT and cs.SP, followed by cs.LG, cs.SI, and cs.MM.
